'Saint John' is the largest city in the Canadian province of New Brunswick, and
the second largest in the maritime provinces. It is known as the Fundy City due
to its location on the north shore of the Bay of Fundy at the mouth of the Saint
John River, as well as being the only city on the bay. Saint John was the first
incorporated city in Canada. [http://www.saintjohn.ca/services_history.cfm
history/public records and archives â The Official Site of The City of Saint
John / Le Site Officiel de The City of Saint John] The Saint
John Metro region covers an area of 323 square kilometres across the Caledonia
Highlands, with a population (as of 2011) of 127,761, marking an increase of
4.4% since 2006. http://www12.statcan.gc.ca/census-recensement/2011/dp-pd/hlt-fst/pd-
pl/Table-Tableau.cfm?LANG=Eng&T=201&S=3&O=D&RPP=150 The city proper had a
population of 70,063.
categories: Port cities and towns on the Canadian Atlantic coast
